div.p: God with us. Dearly beloved son, I thank you and Susanna for the hare you sent me this week; it has arrived well. In return, I am sending you these 2 roast fish; accept them kindly, and eat them joyfully together. Cousin Josue also sends you both these two beautiful little things for the bath, wishing you a healthy and pleasant bath; he greets you sincerely and asks you to accept them kindly from him.

As you requested, I am sending you a note; you may send it well. The new news is also included. I sincerely thank you for your news. To Hans Peyer and you, I wish from God that it may have happened as you said; that the governor has ridden away, if it were true, the seal would be on the letter. May God grant grace and victory. Greet Hans sincerely for me.

Those coming from Italy say that the Venetians have not lost Zaram; they stood well in battle, but retained it. They alone, with their ships and without the help of the Spaniards, have defeated and captured Ochiali and, in a skirmish, destroyed and captured 40 Turkish ships with a glorious victory.
If it is true, we will soon hear about it. From Lyon, Geneva, Strasbourg, Nuremberg, and Augsburg, I have nothing at this time, nor anything from Chur, waiting evermore, etc.

The little bottle for the elecampane wine was arranged for you by my Dorothea; if we survive the autumn and you do something good for me in it, I will earn it for you. May God be with you, Susanna, and the children. Everyone sends you greetings.
To my dearly beloved son Hans Rudolf Bullinger, pastor at Berg.
